title: Typophile Books is Back!
content:
We always knew we’d resuscitate Typophile Books, we just didn’t know how or when. Well it has happened and just in time for the holidays! We realize that we need to dust off our keyboard and update it, but for now check out what is available to you.

[http://typophile.com/books](http://web.archive.org/web/20070331124950/http:/typophile.com/books)

Topics include: Type Design, Type Design: History, Type Design: Lettering, Type Specimens, Typography, Graphic Design, Graphic Design: History, Information Design, Interaction and Web Design, Packaging Design, Publication Design, Advertising Design, Environmental Design, Illustration, Book Arts, Fine Arts, Industrial Design, Printing Arts, Printing History, Book History, and Critical Writing.

Remember that any purchase made through our links benefits Typophile. If you wish to submit suggestions, changes, corrections, or reviews, please e-mail wardle [at] typophile [dot] com.
author: Miss Tiffany

comments.content:
Hey Tiff, great to see this up & running. I’m not at home at the moment, but when I get there I’ll have a look at my shelf and see if I have anything to add or suggest. For the moment, how do we add reviews?

Edit: Oh, right, you mentioned to email such bits to you. Gotcha.

Excellent, Jason. I look forward to adding any content you send my way.

BTW, this is only an interim solution. There will be a whole new area, hopefully with tagging capabilities of somesort, in the next year.

Excellent! There’s a backlog of new books since this went down.\* Maybe you could have a ‘new books’ section and encourage people especially to do reviews there…

Will this be linked to the ‘resources’ section eventually?

\*eg

Printers Type in the Twentieth Century by Richard Southall.  
Designing Type, Karen Cheng.

Hrant, You are welcome.

William, I’m not sure how we will handle the NEW books. When I add a book to the section it would be added to the top of the page, perhaps I could add the word NEW.

I was wondering about the stacking order; obviously it would be nice if the lists were alphabetical (by title?), but if books are on multiple lists this would require some scripting.

Any chance of a “Book Design” section? (Not strictly typography, but not quite Book Arts or Printing Arts.)

Also, perhaps a Magazines section listing currently published design magazines (_CA, Print,_ etc.)?

Tiff, I’m home now and am brimming over with stuff to compile & send you. Get ready…

Thanks Tiff and the folks back there in the corner with notes stuck to their chairs who do the hard work!

ChrisL

Yes the overlap is a result of being able to tag, sort of, in the previous version of Typophile Books.

We can definitely add a book design section.

Alphabetical by title would be good.

Magazines, another good idea.

Jason, you send and I’ll post.

Great job, massive respect.

I am glad that the “29635” post had no reply on the forum, so if you’d like to add  
the _Calligraphy_ section, you can sort out my references at :  
 [http://www.as8.it/edu/bibliography-C.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070331124950/http:/www.as8.it/edu/bibliography-C.html)

A few thoughts from my dreams last night. (Yes, after I work on something intensely for a few days it haunts me in my sleep.) I hope you all don’t mind helping me.

- I’d like to remove overlap. If you see books that are overlapped, please point them out to me. (I’ll look as well.) We’ll vote on where they belong for real.  
- I do want to add Book Design and Calligraphy/Lettering is a good idea too.  
- If you see a book in one section and feel it belongs elsewhere please tell me.  
- Again, don’t be afraid to point out errors. For instance, I realize that all of the books attached to Robin Kinross have the wrong publisher. (This will be fixed immediately.)

Jason, you are a model citizen. Everyone please note how Jason sent me information to be added and follow in his noble footsteps.

Designing Type  
by Karen Cheng  
Publisher: Yale University Press; (April 3, 2006)  
Paperback: 224 pages  
ISBN: 0300111509  
Price: $29.95 (list price)  
 [http://www.amazon.com/Designing-Type-Karen-Cheng/dp/0300111509/sr=1-1/qid=1165538233/ref=pd\_bbs\_sr\_1/002-2314699-9678433?ie=UTF8&s=books](http://web.archive.org/web/20070331124950/http:/www.amazon.com/Designing-Type-Karen-Cheng/dp/0300111509/sr=1-1/qid=1165538233/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1/002-2314699-9678433?ie=UTF8&s=books)

Jason Dewinetz: While I’ve read a few comments both positive & negative on this book, as a reader with no formal training in type design I’ve found the book very useful towards a better understanding of how digital glyphs are put together, based one on another, etc. A well produced & finely illustrated publication.

I realize there have been threads dedicated to horror of Amazon. Please consider that in this instance it is serving a very real and good purpose. When you purchase from Amazon you are doing a small part to support Typophile. So, consider if you are going to suggest a book please check to see if it is available on Amazon first. Then, if it isn’t please do give the link for the other site.

This could be a great resource for everyone looking for books. I hope you are all as enthusiastic about it and ready to participate! Go team!

\> _Also, perhaps a Magazines section listing currently published design magazines (CA, Print, etc.)?_

If you check out Typowiki’s magazine section, I’ve entered a good deal of info there. Maybe you could transfer it to a new link?

Miss Tiffany - this is wonderful. Now when are you going to open the Typophile credit department? This is a good way to go broke fast… :)

peace
